title: Electric potential - at pts X Y Z from q q and -q

content.question: Three point charges are fixed in place along a straight line at the locations shown in the figure. Two of the point charges have a positive charge <math alttext="positive q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>, and the third point charge has a negative charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math>. Also shown are three points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> located along the line. Which of the following correctly ranks the electric potentials <math alttext="V sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="V sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> at points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="V sub X equals V sub Y, which equals V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="V sub X is greater than V sub Y, which is greater than V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="V sub Y is greater than open parenthesis, V sub X equals V sub Z, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="V sub Y is greater than V sub X, which is greater than V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="V sub Y is greater than V sub X, which is greater than V sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>V</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
